ideas.title: Multi-Agent Coordination for OpenClaw
ideas.description: Claude Opus 4.6 introduced 'agent teams' - teams of agents that can split larger tasks into segmented jobs. Apply this to OpenClaw by implementing multi-agent orchestration where sub-agents can collaborate on complex tasks.
ideas.notes: Requires sessions_spawn coordination, task queue management, result aggregation

ideas.title: Context Compaction for Long-Running Tasks
ideas.description: Claude Opus 4.6 can use compaction to summarize its own context and perform longer-running tasks. Implement automatic context summarization for OpenClaw to handle long conversations without token limits.
ideas.notes: Need to implement rolling window summarization, key point extraction

ideas.title: 1M Token Context Support via External Memory
ideas.description: Claude Opus 4.6 supports 1 million token context. For OpenClaw, implement RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) using vector database to simulate large context without high token costs.
ideas.notes: RAG implementation using SQLite + NumPy for vector storage. Implementation completed successfully.

features: CLI interface (init, ingest, search, retrieve, stats, clear)

ideas.title: Automated Security Audit Tool
ideas.description: Claude Opus 4.6 uncovered 500 zero-day flaws in open-source code. Create a security audit skill for OpenClaw that scans codebases for vulnerabilities, buffer overflows, and common security issues.
ideas.notes: Build on existing project-analyzer skill, add security-focused checks. Implementation completed successfully.

completedTasks: Created rules directory for custom detection patterns
Tested on OpenClaw workspace (self-audit completed: 73 files, 1 high-severity issue)

ideas.title: Adaptive Reasoning Control
ideas.description: Claude Opus 4.6 has adaptive thinking that allows the model to dynamically decide when and how much to reason. Implement adaptive reasoning in OpenClaw's task execution - adjust thinking level, model selection, and retries based on task complexity.
ideas.notes: Enhance existing priority-manager and model-manager skills
